title: Silver Spring, Md., is dramatically expanding its stock of luxury apartments
text:
Downtown Silver Spring, Md.’s, mix of shops, restaurants and entertainment venues attracts plenty of visitors and new residents to the area, who also appreciate the transportation hub of the Red Line Metro and numerous bus options.

The Ripley District adjacent to the Silver Spring Metro station, once used for light industrial purposes, is in the midst of a transformation with new restaurants, shops, entertainment, employment and housing options. Eventually the district will be home to as many as 3,000 residents and will have more than 2 million square feet of mixed-use development.
description: TOWN SQUARE | Building amenities of one new building include a rooftop swimming pool, a cafe with free WiFi, a courtyard with grilling areas, a fitness center and a club room that includes a kitchen, a game room, a library, a flat-panel TV and an indoor-outdoor fireplace.
